title: Step 9 - Learn Enough to Do Something Useful
text:
Go back and do more verbal, analytic learning. Now is the time to answer those questions. For this step, you’ll go through all the resources you gathered and learn … in depth.
See also “Start Finishing” at https://github.com/vanHeemstraSystems/start-finishing

title: Step 10 - Teach
text: The final step is to try and teach what you’ve learned.

title: Step 2 - Determine Scope
text: Limit the size of what you want to learn. “Physics” or “philosophy” is too wide and will take decades.

title: Step 7 - Learn Enough to Get Started
text: Nobody reads the whole game manual before they start playing a video game.

title: Step 4 - Find Resources
text: Gather resources from the internet, libraries, forums, etc. that might be useful for your learning project.

title: Step 1 - Get the Big Picture
text:
Scan articles, table of contents, Wikipedia pages, etc. to get an idea of what the field is about.

title: Step 6 - Filter Resources
text: With your plan in mind, narrow down your resource list (Step 4) to the most important essentials.

title: Step 8 - Play Around
text:
Play around and hopefully come up with some questions that you couldn’t find answers to on your own. Playing around gives us the context and tacit knowledge.
See also “Self-Education” at https://github.com/vanHeemstraSystems/self-education

title: Step 5 - Create a Learning Plan
text: Use what you learned in the previous steps to make a plan.

title: Step 3 - Define Success
text: Make a clear goal for your learning so you’ll know when you get there.
